title: Phrack World News
historical_context: This article reflects the hacker and phreaker culture of the late 1980s, highlighting community events and the evolving legal landscape regarding toll fraud.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, security professionals, and those interested in hacker culture history.
short_summary: This issue of Phrack World News discusses the upcoming SummerCon 1987, addresses previous misinformation regarding Oryan QUEST, and reports on significant legal developments in toll fraud cases.
summary:
In this edition of Phrack World News, Knight Lightning opens with an apology regarding past inaccuracies related to Oryan QUEST, clarifying that previous reports were based on false pretenses. The article then shifts focus to the highly anticipated SummerCon 1987, scheduled for June 19-20 in St. Louis, Missouri, promising a gathering of notable figures from the hacking and phreaking communities. Attendees are encouraged to bring cash to support the event, which will feature parties and discussions on various topics pertinent to the community.

Additionally, the article covers a significant legal case involving toll fraud, where a Texas man was convicted for trafficking stolen long-distance access codes. This case marks a pivotal moment in the recognition of toll fraud as a serious crime, with implications for the telecommunications industry, which suffers substantial financial losses due to such activities. The article emphasizes the importance of community awareness regarding security and the potential legal repercussions of hacking activities, reflecting the evolving landscape of hacker culture during this era.
